intro: Scaevola tahitensis, commonly known as the Tahitian fanflower, is a flowering plant native to the Pacific Islands. It belongs to the family Goodeniaceae and is characterized by its showy, bilaterally symmetrical flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a slightly hairy texture. Scaevola tahitensis thrives in coastal areas and is adapted to tolerate salt spray and sandy soils.
